arts.ttl: Roberts on target but Middlesbrough deny Burnley Championship top spot
arts.sum: A fine strike from Connor Roberts was not enough to take Burnley to the top of the Championship as they were held to a draw by Middlesbrough. The Welshman bent in a shot from 25 yards in the 37th minute, but Burnley needed that to cancel out Anfernee Dijksteel’s 13th-minute opener on a night when Turf Moor was battered by wind and rain. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Middlesbrough dressing room reaction to Burnley draw says a lot about their positive mentality
arts.sum: In the grand picture, away from home against a side on a winning run of four consecutively and having not conceded for five games was a good point for Boro. Both teams tried to make the most of it and both of us had spells in the game where we played some good stuff and looked dangerous.

arts.ttl: Boro player ratings vs Burnley as Anfernee Dijksteel is one of two 8s
arts.sum: In a game of two halves, largely because of the influence of the wind, Boro had to put bodies on the line in the first half to go in level, before turning the screw in the second half and having enough of their own chances to win it. A solid and committed defensive performance, particularly in the first half when Boro had to put bodies on the line.

arts.ttl: Dinked finish, wind-powered long-ranger! Burnley, Boro share spoils
arts.sum: Highlights of the Sky Bet Championship match between Burnley and Middlesbrough.

arts.ttl: Connor Roberts earns point but Burnley fail to move top of Championship
arts.sum: The Welshman bent in a shot from 25 yards in the 37th minute.

arts.ttl: 'Baller' Ben Doak is impossible to ignore as Liverpool starlet drops jaws with latest Middlesbrough masterclass
arts.sum: Doak dazzled on the ball as promotion-chasing Middlesbrough battled to a 1-1 draw with Burnley

arts.ttl: Burnley manager Scott Praises highlights 'key' experience of veteran forward Jay Rodriguez
arts.sum: The experience of veteran Burnley forward Jay Rodriguez has been “key” in the club’s recent run of good form, according to manager Scott Parker.

arts.ttl: Burnley player set to leave club permanently – €20m fee, personal terms already sorted out
arts.sum: Zeki Amdouni left Burnley in the summer transfer window, joining Benfica on loan with an option to buy. So far, the 24-year-old has played 17 times in all competitions for Benfica, scoring five times and picking up one assist. The Lisbon club have been left impressed and are set to make the move permanent. arts.ttl: Ben Doak: Scotland's present, Liverpool's future
arts.sum: That day, he played in two seven-a-side matches against two different Accies sides and scored nine goals. Ten years ago, a nine-year-old Ben Doak was playing for Ayr United’s U11s against Hamilton Academicals.
